article: What Does “FRL” Mean? (Plus, When & How to Use It)
intro: You may have seen “FRL” in texting or on social media, but what exactly does it mean? This popular abbreviation stands for “for real,” and it’s often used to check if someone’s being serious, or to express agreement with them. In this article, we’ll teach you everything you need to know about “FRL,” including its various meanings, uses, and other popular slang words.

steps.title: “FRL” is an abbreviation of “for real.”
steps.subtitle: People use “FRL” to check if someone is being serious, to confirm that what they’re saying is true, or to express agreement with another person. When it’s used as a question, “FRL?” is another way of saying “seriously?” or “really?” When it’s used as a statement, it means “I’m serious” or “I agree.”
sub-points: The abbreviation can be written in all uppercase (“FRL”) or all lowercase (“frl”).
Since “FRL” is a slang term, save it for casual conversations with friends, family members, or your romantic partner.
Sometimes, people use “FRL” to mean “for real like,” but it’s less common. Both “for real” and “for real like” have the same meaning.

steps.title: Use “FRL” to agree with someone’s statement.
steps.subtitle: If someone expresses an opinion or belief, reply with “FRL” to show you share the same perspective. It’s another way of saying “totally,” “exactly,” or “I agree,” which can make them feel understood and validated.
sub-points: “Harry looked so hot at the Met Ball 🤤” “FRL!!! He always slays ✨”
“How is she so positive all the time?” “FRL, she needs to share her secrets with the rest of us!”

steps.title: Facts
steps.subtitle: If someone shares a hot take or unpopular opinion, respond with “facts” to convey agreement with them. It’s another way of saying “agreed” or “true,” which typically ends the conversation.
sub-points: “Pineapple on pizza is not as bad as everyone thinks.” “Facts, that’s actually my favorite topping 🤭”
